TrivialFix

commit_message:
Add non *.whl files to MANIFEST.in

This patch switches from using the command/shell module
to using the find module to index the files.

It also adds the files that are not *.whl to the manifest
file to make it easier to implement a staging system for
deployments.

Change-Id: Ie927fb40fdf1f4cb934377320b800a506ed842e2
(cherry picked from commit 5e722bccafd61fa56ffbe7297ae3783c4cf743e9)

commit_message:
Add non *.whl files to MANIFEST.in

This patch switches from using the command/shell module
to using the find module to index the files.

It also adds the files that are not *.whl to the manifest
file to make it easier to implement a staging system for
deployments.

Change-Id: Ie927fb40fdf1f4cb934377320b800a506ed842e2

commit_message:
[docs] Add scenario customisation information to AIO quick start guide

Currently there's no helping information for anyone who wants to
adjust the AIO to add more services. It's also missing information
about how to use scenarios. This resolves that.

Change-Id: I83c3ea2f5229b3af4783e350b7ca156143e5580b
(cherry picked from commit 6d6f34ce15fa205bc20a05a53623c2668673f1b5)

added_lines: various configuration options. Deployers have the option to change how thefor the OpenStack Deployment. For the default AIO scenario, this preparation is completed by executing:If you wish to use a different scenario, for example, the Ceph scenario, execute the following: .. code-block:: shell-session # export SCENARIO='ceph' # scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh To add OpenStack Services over and above the `bootstrap-aio default services`_ for the applicable scenario, copy the ``conf.d`` files with the ``.aio`` file extension into ``/etc/openstack_deploy`` and rename then to ``.yml`` files. For example, in order to enable the OpenStack Telemetry services, execute the following: .. code-block:: shell-session cp etc/openstack_deploy/conf.d/{aodh,gnocchi,ceilometer}.yml.aio /etc/openstack_deploy/conf.d/ for f in $(ls -1 /etc/openstack_deploy/conf.d/*.aio); do mv -v ${f} ${f%.*}; done To add any global overrides, over and above the defaults for the applicable scenario, edit ``/etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml``. See the `Deployment Guide`_ for more details... _bootstrap-aio default services: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstack-ansible/tree/tests/bootstrap-aio.yml?h=stable/ocata

See the `Deployment Guide`_ for more details.

commit_message:
ironic_pxe bootstrap should run on all hosts

Most bootstrap actions use the run_once flag to run on a single host
as they typically involve service-global operations such as database
syncs. The ironic_pxe container bootstrap is different, as it copies
pxelinux files into the ironic_pxe Docker volume. This should be done
on all hosts but currently is only done on one host.

This change performs the ironic_pxe bootstrap on all hosts in the
ironic-pxe group.

Change-Id: Iffd34e6ff26a0ba5140e5d477418cc8aebcdac62
Closes-Bug: #1667153

commit_message:
Remove the openvswitch special case upgrade code

Removed from the tripleo_upgrade_node.sh (major upgrade) & yum_update.sh
(minor update). The workaround is no longer needed and in fact has the
opposite effect killing connectitivity to the node. The 'normal' yum
update on nodes delivers the latest openvswitch 2.6.1 with no drama.

Also adds a 'complete' message, some extra debug echo for logs
and removes the python-zaqarclient install no longer needed

Closes-Bug: 1669714
Change-Id: Icd1517bcade36781fa0da21d045ffd9ec68efc38
(cherry picked from commit 9025a3bc23834e31efc5021acaef80b8d0f5de73)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/84/441184/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: log_debug "Restarting openstack ceilometer agent compute" log_debug "Running puppet step \$step for ${ROLE}" log_debug "Puppet failure at step \${step}" log_debug "Completed puppet step \$step" log_debug "TripleO upgrade run completed."
deleted_lines: $(declare -f special_case_ovs_upgrade_if_needed) special_case_ovs_upgrade_if_needed yum -y install python-zaqarclient # needed for os-collect-config echo "Restarting openstack ceilometer agent compute" echo "Puppet failure at step \${step}"

commit_message:
Rework wait and wait_pass methods

Current implementation can hangs if given function is stuck inside.
Moving RunLimit class from fuel-qa to fuel-devops and reusing it allow
us to catch this errors. Also it will simplify code.

Add ability to pass function arguments to wait methons - no more lambdas!

Add unit tests for both wait methods

Change-Id: I72fd3e3121949f40ee6e768f2747d74a9c7777e6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-devops refs/changes/79/436379/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import signalclass RunLimit(object): def __init__(self, timeout=60, timeout_msg='Timeout'): self.seconds = int(timeout) self.error_message = timeout_msg def handle_timeout(self, signum, frame): raise TimeoutError(self.error_message) def __enter__(self): signal.signal(signal.SIGALRM, self.handle_timeout) signal.alarm(self.seconds) def __exit__(self, exc_type, value, traceback): signal.alarm(0) def _check_wait_args(predicate, predicate_args=None, predicate_kwargs=None): if not callable(predicate): raise TypeError('Not callable raising_predicate has been posted') if not isinstance(predicate_args, (list, tuple)): raise TypeError("Incorrect predicate_args type, should be " "list or tuple, got {}".format(type(predicate_args))) if not isinstance(predicate_kwargs, dict): raise TypeError("Incorrect predicate_kwargs type, should be dict, " "got {}".format(type(predicate_kwargs))) def wait(predicate, interval=5, timeout=60, timeout_msg="Waiting timed out", predicate_args=None, predicate_kwargs=None): """Wait until predicate will become True. :param interval: - seconds between checks. :param timeout: - raise TimeoutError if predicate won't become True after this amount of seconds. :param timeout_msg: - text of the TimeoutError :param predicate_args: - positional arguments for given predicate wrapped in list or tuple :param predicate_kwargs: - dict with named arguments for the predicate predicate_args = predicate_args or [] predicate_kwargs = predicate_kwargs or {} _check_wait_args(predicate, predicate_args, predicate_kwargs) with RunLimit(timeout, timeout_msg): while True: result = predicate(*predicate_args, **predicate_kwargs) if result: return result else: time.sleep(interval) def wait_pass(raising_predicate, expected=Exception, interval=5, timeout=None, timeout_msg="Waiting timed out", predicate_args=None, predicate_kwargs=None): """Wait for successful return from predicate ignoring expected exception Options: :param interval: - seconds between checks. :param timeout: - raise TimeoutError if predicate still throwing expected exception after this amount of seconds. :param timeout_msg: - text of the TimeoutError :param predicate_args: - positional arguments for given predicate wrapped in list or tuple :param predicate_kwargs: - dict with named arguments for the predicate :param expected_exc: Exception that can be ignored while waiting (its possible to pass several using list/tuple """ predicate_args = predicate_args or [] predicate_kwargs = predicate_kwargs or {} _check_wait_args(raising_predicate, predicate_args, predicate_kwargs) with RunLimit(timeout, timeout_msg): while True: try: return raising_predicate(*predicate_args, **predicate_kwargs) except expected as e: logger.debug("Got expected exception {!r}, continue".format(e)) time.sleep(interval)
deleted_lines: def wait(predicate, interval=5, timeout=60, timeout_msg="Waiting timed out"): """Wait until predicate will become True. returns number of seconds that is left or 0 if timeout is None. interval - seconds between checks. timeout - raise error.TimeoutError if predicate won't become True after this amount of seconds. 'None' disables timeout. timeout_msg - text of the error.TimeoutError start_time = time.time() if not timeout: return predicate() while not predicate(): if start_time + timeout < time.time(): msg = ( "{msg}\nWaited for pass {cmd}: {spent:0.3f} seconds." "".format( msg=timeout_msg, cmd=predicate.func_name, spent=time.time() - start_time )) logger.debug(msg) raise error.TimeoutError(timeout_msg) seconds_to_sleep = max( 0, min(interval, start_time + timeout - time.time())) time.sleep(seconds_to_sleep) return timeout + start_time - time.time() def wait_pass( raising_predicate, expected=Exception, interval=5, timeout=None, timeout_msg="Waiting timed out" ): """Wait for successful return from predicate or expected exception""" if not callable(raising_predicate): raise TypeError('Not callable raising_predicate has been posted') start_time = time.time() while True: try: return raising_predicate() except expected: if timeout and start_time + timeout < time.time(): msg = ( "{msg}\nWaited for pass {cmd}: {spent:0.3f} seconds." "".format( msg=timeout_msg, cmd=raising_predicate.func_name, spent=time.time() - start_time )) logger.error(msg) raise time.sleep(interval)

commit_message:
Discard time-sync for some envs

If env is not Fuel, we can't know slaves IPs,
that is why we should not start time-sync procedure.

Change-Id: I15770841ee1c886544cc734ee1ff1674ce2aa3af
Closes-Bug: 1609006

commit_message:
Fixed order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order of arguments in
assertEqual(observed, expected). The correct order expected
by testtool is assertEqual(expected, observed).

Change-Id: I67830328ea3dec2cb5946d656a0e752821eb33c3

commit_message:
Indicating the location tests directory in oslo_debug_helper

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: I4c9bb211efddbad4f3a8e63c3779f3d62112cd32
Closes-Bug: #1666560

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-01 19:37:03.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/370dcd0ba4368c76a9cb80e93821ceb0fd28bd60', 'message': 'Add octavia git repos for pike

1. Add python-octaviaclient repo for the octavia OpenStack client.
2. Add octavia-tempest-plugin to allow work to start in pike to clean up
   the octavia tempest tests and move to the tempest plugin model.
3. Add octavia-dashboard for the octavia horizon plugin.  This will make the
   rename/transition for packagers easier by having a legacy and go-forward
   repository for the horizon plugin.  The I18n work done in ocata will

Change-Id: I6f6bf2ef7e1028e672fd555e5ed250a70e5c4b77
'}]
commit_message:
Add octavia git repos for pike

This patch sets up additional octavia git repositories for activities
planned for pike.

1. Add python-octaviaclient repo for the octavia OpenStack client.
2. Add octavia-tempest-plugin to allow work to start in pike to clean up
   the octavia tempest tests and move to the tempest plugin model.
3. Add octavia-dashboard for the octavia horizon plugin.  This will make the
   rename/transition for packagers easier by having a legacy and go-forward
   repository for the horizon plugin.  The I18n work done in ocata will
   directly apply to the new octavia-dashboard code.

Change-Id: I6f6bf2ef7e1028e672fd555e5ed250a70e5c4b77
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/98/439798/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: neutron-lbaas-dashboard: repos: - openstack/neutron-lbaas-dashboard tags: - stable:follows-policy - openstack/octavia-dashboard tags: - stable:follows-policy octavia-tempest-plugin: repos: - openstack/octavia-tempest-plugin python-octaviaclient: repos: - openstack/python-octaviaclient

commit_message:
Add networking-baremetal under Ironic governance

Networking-baremetal is officially supported project by Ironic
community that keeps Neutron plugin required for Ironic/Neutron
integration. Was decided on Networking/Baremetal cross-project
session in Atlanta [0].

[0] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pike-ptg-ironic-neutron

Change-Id: I3b6a22f2947b5515c24af56e05da496736220466
Depends-On: Ieaf8eec060fea65201fbafca2877683146d0623b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/32/439132/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix paths when moving specs

Needed to use os.path.join to concatenate the paths
when moving the specs from approved to implemented.

Change-Id: Icf39ce8619dcec88d2d69bcbf55ea3888eb3b7a5

added_lines: os.rename(os.path.join(approved_dir, spec_fname), os.path.join(implemented_dir, spec_fname))

Fix a couple of spec names

This renames a couple of specs to match the actual
blueprint name in launchpad and adds redirects for the
old names.

commit_message:
Update run_tests.sh for RDO

This patch updates the run_tests.sh script to add RDO instead of
EPEL and it cleans up some bashate issues where lines weren't tabbed
out in multiples of four spaces.

Change-Id: I622003afe4b9bdfc22e38326372cf245c337adc7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/42/442742/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: curl --silent --show-error --retry 5 \ https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py | sudo python2.7# rdo-release-ocata - required to install python-ndg_httpsclient/python2-pyasn1 RDO_RPM=https://rdoproject.org/repos/openstack-ocata/rdo-release-ocata.rpm wget -q $RDO_RPM -O /tmp/rdo-release-ocata.rpm sudo yum -y install redhat-lsb-core /tmp/rdo-release-ocata.rpm sudo apt-get -q --option "Dpkg::Options::=--force-confold" \ --assume-yes install $BINDEP_PKGS sudo yum install -y $BINDEP_PKGS echo "Executing tox environment: ${tox_env}" if [[ ${tox_env} == ansible-functional ]]; then if ${FUNCTIONAL_TEST}; then tox -e ${tox_env} fi else tox -e ${tox_env}
deleted_lines: curl --silent --show-error --retry 5 \ https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py | sudo python2.7# epel-release - required to install python-ndg_httpsclient/python2-pyasn1 sudo yum -y install redhat-lsb-core epel-release sudo apt-get -q --option "Dpkg::Options::=--force-confold" \ --assume-yes install $BINDEP_PKGS sudo yum install -y $BINDEP_PKGS echo "Executing tox environment: ${tox_env}" if [[ ${tox_env} == ansible-functional ]]; then if ${FUNCTIONAL_TEST}; then tox -e ${tox_env} else tox -e ${tox_env} fi

commit_message:
exabgp: install master branch of official repo

* possible know that key python3 compatibility fixes have merged there
* to change into a clean requirements.txt dependency once exabgp 4.x
  is published

Change-Id: I38999e79971704451e7ad6fa1dabdfeadb7b51f3

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-08 18:20:29.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/horizon_apache.yml', 'vars/redhat-7.yml', 'vars/debian.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_horizon/commit/4f4e75db88a8c77053d3bb773617335225e42a01', 'message': "Ensure the log folder exists

Change-Id: I041a044ef88aff917eeb3a618c2c08ac9ceb80fe

commit_message:
Ensure the log folder exists

Restarting the apache service under ubuntu read the envvars file.
This envvars contains the folder for logrotate. If the folder
doesn't exist or hasn't the apache permissions, the restart of
the service will fail.

We ensure here the folder properly exists, with the right
permissions.

Change-Id: I041a044ef88aff917eeb3a618c2c08ac9ceb80fe
(cherry picked from commit bbe5bb7c3c81273a18206d38600391168d395522)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_horizon refs/changes/63/443263/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: horizon_apache_default_log_folder: "/var/log/apache2" horizon_apache_default_log_owner: "root" horizon_apache_default_log_grp: "adm"

commit_message:
Add editing for port security

Now it is possible to enable/disable port security in Horizon, when
the port-security extension is available.

Closes-Bug: #1634877
Change-Id: I6b17b49bca8e5d1a2aff10fe613ecd70590c097b

services (per I208c1ef1550ab39ab0ee47ab282f9b1937379810)

commit_message:
Ensure the log folder exists

Restarting the apache service under ubuntu read the envvars file.
This envvars contains the folder for logrotate. If the folder
doesn't exist or hasn't the apache permissions, the restart of
the service will fail.

We ensure here the folder properly exists, with the right
permissions.

Change-Id: I041a044ef88aff917eeb3a618c2c08ac9ceb80fe
(manual cherry pick from commit bbe5bb7c3c81273a18206d38600391168d395522)

added_lines: horizon_apache_default_log_folder: "/var/log/apache2" horizon_apache_default_log_owner: "root" horizon_apache_default_log_grp: "adm"

commit_message:
Update test set and use test plugins

Previously the test set used was the default set in
the os_tempest role, which are scenario tests. Those
tests cannot run without more services deployed.

This patch implements the use of API tests and the
tempest plugins from the Neutron repository.

Additionally, the postgresql library is removed as
it is no longer required and the tempest plugin
branches have all been adjusted appropriately.

Change-Id: I4710511d7824ad031cafb4dac5521c0b1b34931e
(cherry picked from commit 4eb8a56fb12a5e837a63fb2344ad6547ffec0785)

commit_message:
Revert setting local memcached server for swift proxy

Switch back to using all available mamcached servers, because of
failures during swift testing.

Change-Id: I251b465dadd8ffe9a15b1a7092168d89acd2d72b
Closes-Bug: 1666837
(cherry picked from commit f7e609e612a9fd95a2f44399315a73d744c1ef7c)

commit_message:
Add validation for VPP upgrade tasks

Change-Id: I54a3cac11ae63c553f831a3f8eeca2cbe4cc88d3
Signed-off-by: Feng Pan <fpan@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/59/438959/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Check if VPP is deployed command: systemctl is-enabled vpp tags: step0,validation ignore_errors: True register: vpp_enabled - name: "PreUpgrade step0,validation: Check service vpp is running" shell: /usr/bin/systemctl show 'vpp' --property ActiveState | grep '\bactive\b' when: vpp_enabled.rc == 0 tags: step0,validation

deleted_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from django.core.urlresolvers import reverse from django import http from mox3.mox import IsA # noqa from openstack_dashboard.api import cinder from openstack_dashboard.test import helpers as test from openstack_dashboard.dashboards.admin.volumes.snapshots import forms INDEX_URL = 'horizon:admin:volumes:index' class VolumeSnapshotsViewTests(test.BaseAdminViewTests): @test.create_stubs({cinder: ('volume_snapshot_reset_state', 'volume_snapshot_get')}) def test_update_snapshot_status(self): snapshot = self.cinder_volume_snapshots.first() state = 'error' cinder.volume_snapshot_get(IsA(http.HttpRequest), snapshot.id) \ .AndReturn(snapshot) cinder.volume_snapshot_reset_state(IsA(http.HttpRequest), snapshot.id, state) self.mox.ReplayAll() formData = {'status': state} url = reverse('horizon:admin:volumes:snapshots:update_status', args=(snapshot.id,)) res = self.client.post(url, formData) self.assertNoFormErrors(res) @test.create_stubs({cinder: ('volume_snapshot_get', 'volume_get')}) def test_get_volume_snapshot_details(self): volume = self.cinder_volumes.first() snapshot = self.cinder_volume_snapshots.first() cinder.volume_get(IsA(http.HttpRequest), volume.id). \ AndReturn(volume) cinder.volume_snapshot_get(IsA(http.HttpRequest), snapshot.id). \ AndReturn(snapshot) self.mox.ReplayAll() url = reverse('horizon:admin:volumes:snapshots:detail', args=[snapshot.id]) res = self.client.get(url) self.assertTemplateUsed(res, 'horizon/common/_detail.html') self.assertEqual(res.context['snapshot'].id, snapshot.id) @test.create_stubs({cinder: ('volume_snapshot_get', 'volume_get')}) def test_get_volume_snapshot_details_with_snapshot_exception(self): # Test to verify redirect if get volume snapshot fails snapshot = self.cinder_volume_snapshots.first() cinder.volume_snapshot_get(IsA(http.HttpRequest), snapshot.id).\ AndRaise(self.exceptions.cinder) self.mox.ReplayAll() url = reverse('horizon:admin:volumes:snapshots:detail', args=[snapshot.id]) res = self.client.get(url) self.assertNoFormErrors(res) self.assertMessageCount(error=1) self.assertRedirectsNoFollow(res, reverse(INDEX_URL)) @test.create_stubs({cinder: ('volume_snapshot_get', 'volume_get')}) def test_get_volume_snapshot_details_with_volume_exception(self): # Test to verify redirect if get volume fails volume = self.cinder_volumes.first() snapshot = self.cinder_volume_snapshots.first() cinder.volume_get(IsA(http.HttpRequest), volume.id). \ AndRaise(self.exceptions.cinder) cinder.volume_snapshot_get(IsA(http.HttpRequest), snapshot.id). \ AndReturn(snapshot) self.mox.ReplayAll() url = reverse('horizon:admin:volumes:snapshots:detail', args=[snapshot.id]) res = self.client.get(url) self.assertNoFormErrors(res) self.assertMessageCount(error=1) self.assertRedirectsNoFollow(res, reverse(INDEX_URL)) def test_get_snapshot_status_choices_without_current(self): current_status = {'status': 'available'} status_choices = forms.populate_status_choices(current_status, forms.STATUS_CHOICES) self.assertEqual(len(status_choices), len(forms.STATUS_CHOICES)) self.assertNotIn(current_status['status'], [status[0] for status in status_choices]) @test.create_stubs({cinder: ('volume_snapshot_get',)}) def test_update_volume_status_get(self): snapshot = self.cinder_volume_snapshots.first() cinder.volume_snapshot_get(IsA(http.HttpRequest), snapshot.id). \ AndReturn(snapshot) self.mox.ReplayAll() url = reverse('horizon:admin:volumes:snapshots:update_status', args=[snapshot.id]) res = self.client.get(url) status_option = "<option value=\"%s\"></option>" % snapshot.status self.assertNotContains(res, status_option)

commit_message:
Refactor Project Volumes stand-alone panel

Note that there was state leaking from one of the existing
tests that was relied upon in other tests and moving that test
in the run order caused the others to fail. All related tests
have been altered to not leak state.

Change-Id: I972bc5650fa77044de8a027f570cf2cb41febef8
Implements: blueprint reorganise-volumes

commit_message:
Adding haproxy package to Neutron

This patch adds haproxy package to devstack as Neutron will rely on it
for serving metadata instead of the current Python implementation.

haproxy will reduce the memory footprint from ~50MB to ~1.5MB for
serving metadata. It will be spawned for every Neutron router so,
for large deployments, it will be a significant memory reduction.

Change-Id: I36a5531cacc21c0d4bb7f20d4bec6da65d04c262

commit_message:
tox: remove sitepackage=True

remove sitepackage=True to set sitepackage=False by default.
sitepackage=True causes pip install error with stable/ocata branch.
appdirs 1.4.3 is installed on system, but stable/ocata requires appdirs 1.4.0.
pip find appdirs 1.4.3 of global package, but pip fails to uninstall appdirs
in venv.
sitepackage=False resolves it.

Change-Id: I40b60f53b18b60594f9adcf1e280b2b32d35d123
Closes-bug: #1671323

commit_message:
Add vCenter test compatibility with 9.0 and 9.1 releases

Currently we don't have compatibility with 9.0 and 9.1 due to
changes of insecure parameter for vCenter in nailgun API and can't
run vCenter suite against these releases. Furthermore, DVS, NSXv
and NSX-t plugins use fuel-qa for configuration vcenter parameters
and we need save compatibility for all 9.x releases.
In additional was removed redundate code and increased timeout for
creation instances.

Change-Id: Ifbb7cef271aceef22544fc23adc49261e192be5d

dictionary with string keys: cluster name (cluster), service name (srv_name), datastore regex (datastore), target node (target_node) """ nodes = self.client.list_cluster_nodes(cluster_id) commit_message:
Add hacking rules for deprecated LOG.warn

Because LOG.warn is deprecated,
we should replace LOG.warn with LOG.warning.

This patch add a hacking rule:
    [N313] - Validate that LOG.warning is used instead of deprecated LOG.warn.

and replace deprecated LOG.warn with LOG.warning in rally/api.py

Change-Id: I7d016b30368f13bde822ca27ef503ce09e3e875b
Closes-Bug: #1508442
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/79/442379/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * [N313] - Validate that LOG.warning is used instead of deprecated LOG.warn.

commit_message:
Enable Docker service for Compute role

A recent commit [1] change how docker is installed and configured on
the overcloud nodes, from a cloud-init script to a proper puppet
profile in puppet-tripleo but forgot to enable the docker service on
the compute nodes.

[1] Ia50169819cb959025866348b11337728f8ed5c9e

Change-Id: I202723d0e48f110e5b0dbfe3dcf6646da9f37948

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-03 17:24:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4a58e30c612c2c499ec63405d19739d9bc91a840', 'message': "fdatasync() downloaded images before use

Image download closes the filehandle of the downloaded image before
use, but doesn't fdatasync it. This means that in the event of a host
crash we may be left with only the file metadata when the host comes
back up: i.e. an empty file of the correct size. Nova cannot detect
this data corruption, so operator intervention is required.

By adding an fdatasync() before closing the file handle we ensure that

is required in any case.

commit_message:
fdatasync() downloaded images before use

Image download closes the filehandle of the downloaded image before
use, but doesn't fdatasync it. This means that in the event of a host
crash we may be left with only the file metadata when the host comes
back up: i.e. an empty file of the correct size. Nova cannot detect
this data corruption, so operator intervention is required.

By adding an fdatasync() before closing the file handle we ensure that
the downloaded file is either entirely present, or entirely not
present.

See also change I33bd99b0, which fixes this issue for downloads
requiring a subsequent conversion step.

Partial-Bug: #1669844
Change-Id: Id9905a87f16f66530623800e33e2581c555ae81d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/46/441246/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os # Ensure that the data is pushed all the way down to # persistent storage. This ensures that in the event of a # subsequent host crash we don't have running instances # using a corrupt backing file. os.fdatasync(data.fileno())

commit_message:
install: Remove json highlighting

Sphinx 1.5 complains about invalid json:
"WARNING: Could not lex literal_block as "json". Highlighting skipped."

Change the invalid json to "none" to allow install guide to build.

Change-Id: I0cb28c3ea91fcf58c44de6ac046f481e3b808336

commit_message:
Docs: Various fixes

Treat warnings as errors when building documents to early spot problems.

Fix api-ref set up:
* Add openstackdocstheme for api-ref building instead of oslosphinx and
  configure it properly.
* Setup api-ref log-a-bug correctly for this project.
* Remove unneeded extra install command

Fix install-guide set up:
* Add tox environment

Fix releasenotes set up:
* Fix conf.py settings to build without errors, remove index, we don't
  need it.

fix docs set up:
* Use Sphinx 1.5 warning-is-error option for normal build_sphinx.
* use oslo sphinx
* Remove wrong static path setting

Change-Id: I07ce9db9fdb526ab4b083c65afa99c38bb508146

commit_message:
requirements: add pyroute2 to the runtime reqs

This has worked so far because kuryr-lib, which is a requirement of
kuryr-kubernetes has pyroute2 as a requirement. However, since
kuryr-kubernetes is a direct consumer of pyroute2 with its binding code,
we can't pretend this is an indirect dependency. We must include it
here.

Change-Id: I882fa9b7159e01c159a77eb949a0bf1e76f51a81
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/67/442867/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pyroute2>=0.4.12 # Apache-2.0 (+ dual licensed GPL2)

subject: Set number of Swift proxy server workers to auto
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-09 19:06:02.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/swift-proxy.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/892827c639d7b72ff2020e5f3fa5bc6db6a608df', 'message': 'Set number of Swift proxy server workers to auto

Setting the default Swift proxy workers to 0 actually results in a
single Swift proxy worker, no matter how many CPU cores are available.
This is not the default Swift setting and is most likely not sufficient.

Setting this to auto uses the default in Swift, which equals to the
number of CPU cores.

Closes-Bug: 1655070
Change-Id: Ic321b6111f8697ba3cc1554611fee44c2e540759
'}]
commit_message:
Set number of Swift proxy server workers to auto

Setting the default Swift proxy workers to 0 actually results in a
single Swift proxy worker, no matter how many CPU cores are available.
This is not the default Swift setting and is most likely not sufficient.

Setting this to auto uses the default in Swift, which equals to the
number of CPU cores.

Closes-Bug: 1655070
Change-Id: Ic321b6111f8697ba3cc1554611fee44c2e540759
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/29/418029/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default: auto type: string

commit_message:
Split configuration astute.yaml into common and node parts

This file is huge if there are many nodes in cluster. Now
we generate it and store in memory for each node and it
takes a lot of time and memory.

Let's split it into common and node-specific parts so that
we can generate common part once and copy it from master
node to each node affected by deployment.

Change-Id: I114a8598460bef9063e43505f46fe38cd564d8c7
Closes-Bug: #1660308
(cherry-picked from commit id cfd2588728e855a6b4aee7b1c7516a0aefa26b42)

commit_message:
Fix networking guide after neutron-dynamic-routing split

The neutron-dynamic-routing has been split from neutron core in the
Newton cycle. With that split the module names that need to be
referenced in the config have changed.

Change-Id: I6df443b4b2fcc129da3af4c404c3dc700394b3d1
Closes-Bug: 1647252

commit_message:
Check if env.d folder exists for upgrades

If an env.d folder does not exist then no actions
should be done relating to the contents of the
folder.

Change-Id: I3ea94aa2882cba6dd8cc9550bac68fedcc4658b7

No new changes" when: diff_result.stdout == "" - name: Write vars required for upgrade

commit_message:
Changed libvirt unit name

Xenial has renamed "libvirt-bin" to "libvirtd" and while the links for
libvirt-bin work if we use the service module they're broken when using
the systemdctl module.

Change-Id: I56716fac367ddf6a364688ef4ca754c3991d6e19
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/79/443179/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: libvirt_service_name: libvirtd

commit_message:
Allow environment variable overrides

As is, the variables.sh file will clobber envvars. Don't do that
anymore.

Change-Id: I6afc0eb354c19ebc96fc51f0dcf06d89aa3cabfe

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_monasca-ui refs/changes/31/436731/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Role Name ========= Openstack ansible role to install Monasca UI. Requirements ------------ Any pre-requisites that may not be covered by Ansible itself or the role should be mentioned here. For instance, if the role uses the EC2 module, it may be a good idea to mention in this section that the boto package is required. Role Variables -------------- A description of the settable variables for this role should go here, including any variables that are in defaults/main.yml, vars/main.yml, and any variables that can/should be set via parameters to the role. Any variables that are read from other roles and/or the global scope (ie. hostvars, group vars, etc.) should be mentioned here as well. Dependencies ------------ A list of other roles hosted on Galaxy should go here, plus any details in regards to parameters that may need to be set for other roles, or variables that are used from other roles. Example Playbook ---------------- Including an example of how to use your role (for instance, with variables passed in as parameters) is always nice for users too: - hosts: servers roles: - { role: username.rolename, x: 42 } License ------- BSD Author Information ------------------ An optional section for the role authors to include contact information, or a website (HTML is not allowed).

commit_message:
Indicating the location tests directory in oslo_debug_helper

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: I5c25c86a79ace5be46c7254cc0ccdc2183303a7c
Closes-Bug: #1666560

commit_message:
Implement the oslo_db enginefacade proposal

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-specs refs/changes/98/266898/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================== Use the enginefacade from oslo_db ================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/sahara/+spec/use-oslodb-enginefacade Implement the new oslo.db enginefacade interface described here: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.db/+spec/make-enginefacade-a-facade Problem description =================== The linked oslo.db spec contains the details of the proposal, including its general advantages to all projects. In summary, we transparently track database transactions using the sahara.Context object. This means that if there is already a transaction in progress we will use it by default, only creating a separate transaction if explicitly requested. Use Cases ---------- These changes will only affect developers. * Allow a class of database races to be fixed Sahara currently only exposes db transactions in sahara/db/sqlalchemy/api.py, which means that every db api call is in its own transaction. Although this will remain the same initially, the new interface allows a caller to extend a transaction across several db api calls if they wish. This will enable callers who need these to be atomic to achieve this, which includes the save operation on several Sahara objects. * Reduce connection load on the database Many database api calls currently create several separate database connections, which increases load on the database. By reducing these to a single connection, load on the db will be decreased. * Improve atomicity of API calls By ensuring that database api calls use a single transaction, we fix a class of bug where failure can leave a partial result. * Make greater use of slave databases for read-only transactions The new api marks sections of code as either readers or writers, and enforces this separation. This allows us to automatically use a slave database connection for all read-only transactions. It is currently only used when explicitly requested in code. Proposed change =============== * Decorate the sahara.Context class sahara.context.Context is annotated with the @enginefacade.transaction_context_provider decorator. This adds several code hooks which provide access to the transaction context via the sahara.Context object, including attributes 'session', 'connection', 'transaction'. * Ensure that all database apis use context session Use context session in sahara.db.sqlalchemy.api.model_query(). * Update database apis incrementally Invidual calls will be annotated as either readers or writers. Existing transaction management will be replaced. Database apis will be updated in batches, by function. For example, clusters apis, jobs apis, templates apis. Calls into apis which have not been upgraded yet will continue to explicitly pass the session or connection object. Alternatives ------------ Alternatives were examined during the design of the oslo.db code. The goal of this change is to implement a solution which is common across OpenStack projects. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Deployer impact --------------- None Developer impact ---------------- The initial phase of this work will be to implement the new engine facade in sahara/db/sqlalchemy/api.py only. Callers will not have to consider transaction context if they do not currently do so, as it will be created and destroyed automatically. This change will allow developers to explicitly extend database transaction context to cover several database calls. This allows the caller to make multiple database changes atomically. Sahara-image-elements impact ---------------------------- None Sahara-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: javeme Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Enable use of the new api in Sahara * Migrate api bundles along functional lines: * Cluster * NodeGroup * Instance, Volume * ClusterTemplate * NodeGroupTemplate * TemplatesRelation * DataSource * JobExecution * Job * JobInterfaceArgument * JobBinaryInternal * JobBinary * ClusterEvent * ClusterProvisionStep Dependencies ============ A version of oslo.db including the new enginefacade api: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/138215/ Testing ======= This change is intended to have no immediate functional impact. The current tests should continue to pass. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== * Implement the oslo.db enginefacade interface described here: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.db/+spec/make-enginefacade-a-facade * Use the new oslo_db enginefacade in Nova: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/new-oslodb-enginefacade

commit_message:
Resource Check before Cluster Creation

Currently we do not do any resource check before creating cluster, and
it might cause issues. We can add a resource-checking phase before
cluster infrastructuring phase, to minimize the possibilities of this case.

implements bp: resource-check-before-cluster-creation
Change-Id: Id9376ae04d2bd6feb3e168b2ca90f4bcf7e213a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-specs refs/changes/10/235110/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========================================== Check Node Resource before Creating Cluster =========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/sahara/+spec/resource-check-before-cluster-creation This blueprint aims to implement node resource checking before cluster creating. Problem description =================== Currently we do not check the resources of each node whether they can satisfy the requirments of the roles assigned on it. This can cause issues. For example, the roles on a node may need 8GB memory/20GB disk, while we only have 4GB memory, or 10GB disk size on this node or volume. This may cause the cluster creation fail but users do not know why if they do not (or cannot) log into the cluster and check the plugin-specific debug info. Proposed change =============== We can add a resource-checking phase before cluster infrastructuring phase, to minimize the possibilities of this case. To achieve this, we need to register the OS sytem and roles' resource requirements, and check whether the flavor and volumes allocated can meet them. If no, invloved exceptions can be thrown and users can know the reason, or cluster creating can go on. At the first step, we can just set it as a gating check, that means we do not promise all clusters passing this phase will never have resource issues in the future. Instead, it just help users to avoid the likely problems in most cases. We plan to implement this feature as below: * In cluster creating phase (service.api._cluster_create), add a step check_resources, which will call plugins.check_resources method, to finish the resource checking. * In plugins.provisioning.ProvisioningPluginBase, add an abstract method check_resources. * In each plugin, implement this method individually. If not implemented, we just skip this step and return success. * We take cdh plugin as example. We initialize a list of required resources for each role and system OS, which will include the memory size and disk size. For each node, we check the node groups, and compare the node setup and the sum of required resources of all set roles and OS. The default required resource for each role is 0, if not set. .. note:: The implementation of check_resources given above is not the final solution. More optimal or reasonable ways can be applied in the future. Alternatives ------------ None. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Deployer impact --------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Sahara-image-elements impact ---------------------------- None. Sahara-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Ken Chen Work Items ---------- We will change the according files in service and plugins directories. And we will add test cases for the methods added. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= * Unit tests will be added to test the added methods. Documentation Impact ==================== The documentation needs to be updated with information about this feature. References ========== N/A

commit_message:
Add Rolling Upgrade Support in Sahara

The following spec tells why we want to introduce rolling upgrade
to sahara and how to do this by versioned resources and and RPC
compatibility layer.

Change-Id: Ic0379ddce3dd07c3353caf662f769547ebba022f
Partially implements: blueprint rolling-upgrade-for-sahara
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-specs refs/changes/56/245556/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================== Rolling Upgrade For Sahara ========================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/sahara/+spec/rolling-upgrade-for-sahara The folling proposal is to enable rolling upgrade in sahara. Rolling upgrade means allowing sahara services (sahara-api, sahara-engine, and maybe more if other services like sahara-conductor is splited out in the future) to be updated one at a time and yet still be operational (only one service is taken down for upgrade instead of all). Currently in sahara we only have two services, the benefit from rolling upgrade is not quite obvious. However considering in the future we may split sahara into more services to lease the burden of each part, it can be more helpful. Rolling upgrade in sahara will be like in cinder and heat, where we use versioned object and RPC backward compatibility to implement rolling upgrade. Problem description =================== When we release a new milestone, we need to upgrade all services to the latest release. Upgrading will involve: synching the database to the latest schema and updating each distributed service. The process can take down the cloud for a long time. That is why we want to help reduce the down time for those cloud operators. The optimized way is to individually upgrade each service to the latest release without taking down the whole cloud in the process. Proposed change =============== The proposed change is similar to what was did in cinder (I list the reference URL at the end). We will rephase it here, and talk about the difference in sahara. To upgrade distributed services in sahara, the following things can be changed: 1. The content sent over RPC, 2. The RPC interface itself. We can introduce versioned objects to resolve the content backward compatibility issue, and pin RPC interface to a specific version until all components are upgraded to resolve the second problem. The implementaion will include: 1. Objects will be database schema independent and versioned. It allows older objects to be detected and taking appropriate actions when the objects are incompatible, i.e. fail gracefully or emulate old behavior. 2. When a service starts, it register the RPC and object versions it knows about, i.e. minimun and latest versions. 3. On upgrade, the admin upgrades each individual sahara service. When the service is restarted, it knows that there is a newer version, but continue to run at the current/pinned version indicated in the database. The database is the source truth for which version a service should run. 4. The service constantly check the database for the current available RPC and object versions, and once all sahara services are upgraded, the admin executes a "sahara-manage version upgrade" to switch the current/pinned versions to the latest available versions in the database. When the service find the current version is equal to its available version, it will no longer check the database. 5. Restart the service once, and now the service will be using the new RPC and object versions. In the other projects in Openstack like cinder, step 1 was simply done by importing oslo_versionedobjects. Before this, changes were directly applied to database. However, in sahara we already has a resource layer to wrap the data, so we need not import oslo_versionedobjects but change the resource into versioned. When the sahara resources are changed versioned, and the RPC compatibility is added, rolling upgrade should be supported. Rolling upgrade should be limited not too older. In cinder project, it was limited to two release older. We can also follow this. Alternatives ------------ The upgrade process can be left as-is, where all the components must be taken down and upgraded at the same time. Data model impact ----------------- A new table, called service_versions, would be created to track the RPC and object versions. The schema would be as follows: service_versions = Table( ‘service_versions’, meta, Column(‘created_at’, DateTime(timezone=False)), Column(‘updated_at’, DateTime(timezone=False)), Column(‘deleted_at’, DateTime(timezone=False)), Column(‘deleted’, Boolean(create_constraint=True, name=None)), Column(‘id’, Integer, primary_key=True, nullable=False), Column(‘service_id’, String(length=255)), Column(‘rpc_current_version’, String(length=36)), Column(‘rpc_available_version’, String(length=36)), Column(‘object_current_version’, String(length=36)), Column(‘object_available_version’, String(length=36)), mysql_engine=’InnoDB’ ) The service_id is service name + host. The _current_version is the version a service is currently running and pinned at. The _available_version is the version a service knows about and (if newer) could upgrade to. REST API impact --------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- A new command, i.e. "sahara-manage version upgrade", would be introduced to switch the sahara services to use the latest RPC and object versions. Performance impact ------------------ During upgrading, it would incur a cost on performance because there would be extra database calls to find the current and available RPC and object versions. Deployer impact --------------- None Developer impact ---------------- We need to change all resources to versioned, and all referring to those resources will be made against the appropriate resource methods. It will take some time to convert all those to the versioned model. Any new changes to the RPC interface in service/ops.py would have to add to the backwards compatible layer from when this feature merges and onwards. Also, any new changes to an object, e.g. node group template, cluster, etc., must be made backwards compatible in the object’s obj_make_compatible(). Sahara-image-elements impact ---------------------------- None. Sahara-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Ken Chen Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Create service_versions table to track RPC and object versions. * Register each sahara service's RPC and object versions on startup (currently only sahara-api and sahara-engine). * Create RPC compatibility layer in utils/rpc.py to massage the object and RPC interface before sahara-api send them to sahara-engine over RPC. * Create a "sahara-manage version upgrade" CLI to switch each cinder service to use the latest versions. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Ideally, there should be a rolling upgrade test within tempest to test basic RPC and object pinning between different releases. However, such testing would only apply to release M and onwards because most of the versioned object and RPC compatibility layers are not in previous releases. Documentation Impact ==================== It should be documented that operators can upgrade sahara components individually, without taking down the entire cloud. At the end of the process, a "sahara-manage version upgrade" must be executed to switch the services to use the latest RPC and object versions. References ========== [1]: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/cinder-objects [2]: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/cinder-specs/specs/kilo/cinder-objects.html [3]: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/rpc-object-compatibility [4]: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/cinder-specs/specs/liberty/rpc-object-compatibility.html

commit_message:
Add instance_meta to node group templates

Change-Id: I80e3c1ee472ad41808813771842870b50bafcd37
Implements bp: add-instance-meta-to-node-group-template
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-specs refs/changes/28/222528/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Add instance_meta to node group template ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/sahara/+spec/add-instance-meta-to-node-group-template This specification proposes to add an opportunity to set some extra property of instances when create cluster. Problem description =================== In some cases, some extra property of instance is needed, but currently there is no way to do this. This feature would be useful. Proposed change =============== There will be several changes: * Json field ``instance_meta`` will be added to every node group adn node group template. This field wiil be optional adn ``None`` by default. * If ``instance_meta`` is not None, instance_meta will be passed as ``meta`` to nova to boot instance. For example, when I use novadocker, I can set volumes mount info in instance_meta so that novadocker can get this from instance's meta and enable container to mount specified volumes. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- ``instance_meta`` field should be added to ``node_groups``, ``node_group_templates`` REST API impact --------------- * API will extended to support ``instance_meta`` option, as it's optional argument with ``None`` value by default, this change will be backward compatible. * python client will be updated Other end user impact --------------------- None Deployer impact --------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Sahara-image-elements impact ---------------------------- None Sahara-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- New field to set ``instance_meta`` option during node group template creation. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: lvdongbing Work Items ---------- * Adding ability to set instance_meta by API; * Adding unit tests; * Updating documentation; * Updating python client; * Updating UI. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit tests will be added. Documentation Impact ==================== Documentation will be updated. References ========== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/sahara/+spec/add-instance-meta-to-node-group-template

commit_message:
Add new spec for NFS-as-a-data-source blueprint

Update spec for NFS as a data source

Related blueprint: nfs-as-a-data-source

Change-Id: I324394e5b2c51d638ef107d46e17c6c86340c561
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-specs refs/changes/39/210839/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================== NFS as a Data Source ==================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/sahara/+spec/nfs-as-a-data-source Network File System are a common storage protocol to share file. Hadoop can also support NFS protocol by using NetApp Hadoop NFS Driver. This driver bring the capability to help Hadoop support NFS as a data source directly. Problem description =================== To support NFS in Hadoop must put NetApp Hadoop NFS Driver into the image and add NFS as a data source in Sahara interface. Once the driver has been implemented in Sahara, the user can use Manila NFS share to expose NFS location to Sahara. Proposed change =============== The proposal is target for Vanilla Plugin at first. NFS Authentication is also be ignored in 1st release, There are several changes in Sahara projects. In sahara-image-elements: 1) Add an element for NetApp Hadoop NFS Driver v1.0.6 2) Driver can get from below url: https://github.com/NetApp/NetApp-Hadoop-NFS-Connector/releases/download/v1.0.6/ hadoop-nfs-connector-1.0.6.jar 3) Install the element in Vanilla Image In sahara: 1) Like Swift, add a folder(sahara/nfs/) nfs to put the related source code in it 1.1) Add nfs_helper.py in this folder to get nfs configs 1.2) Add utils.py in this folder to handle nfs url suffix 2) Add the related configurations in sahara/plugins/vanilla/hadoop2 2.1) In config.py, to check if NFS is enabled 2.2) In config_helper.py, to handle the default value for NFS 3) Add NFS in sahara/plugins/vanilla/v2_6_0/resources/core_default.xml, there are four settings for NetApp Hadoop NFS Driver 3.1) fs.defaultFS: No need to set, the value must be keep and by default, it still use hdfs. NFS driver is just an option. 3.2) fs.nfs.configuration: it will be set to the location of nfs-mapping.json file. nfs-mapping.json shows the detail nfs topology, including nfs address and available folder to be access. 3.3) fs.nfs.impl: This is a static parameter to enable hadoop-nfs-connector-1.0.6.jar 3.4) fs.AbstractFileSystem.nfs.impl: This is a static parameter to enable hadoop-nfs-connector-1.0.6.jar How to use: After the driver installed in the cluster, the user can use nfs protocol directly in Hadoop. The command should like below: "hadoop -jar xxx.jar nfs://path" Alternatives ------------ None. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Deployer impact --------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Sahara-image-elements impact ---------------------------- None. Sahara-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- NFS checkbox will be added in "Create Cluster Template", by default it is enabled. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: weiting-chen Secondary assignee/reviewer: chen-li Work Items ---------- * Install NFS driver in Vanilla image(sahara-image-elements) * Add the related configuration files in Sahara * Add a json to set up NFS configuration * Add a new Data Source - NFS. * Test in Sahara EDP by using NFS driver. * Horizon Changes. * Documentation. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= Unit testing is also planning to add in this case. It depends on the feasibility. Documentation Impact ==================== This feature will require documentation in edp.rst. References ========== Please refer to https://github.com/NetApp/NetApp-Hadoop-NFS-Connector for more information.

commit_message:
Refactor cell loading in compute/api

This merely pulls out the loading of the global cells cache
into a helper function that can be used by later patches that
will also depend on this. Since it's the same code, existing
tests exercise this path just like they did before it was moved.

This was moved out of another patch to re-order some dependencies.

Related to blueprint cells-aware-api
Change-Id: Idb25f5905f3e33cec3c7887d08408251fef5b262
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/37/443337/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def load_cells(): global CELLS if not CELLS: CELLS = objects.CellMappingList.get_all( nova_context.get_admin_context()) LOG.debug('Found %(count)i cells: %(cells)s', dict(count=len(CELLS), cells=CELLS)) if not CELLS: LOG.error(_LE('No cells are configured, unable to continue')) load_cells()
deleted_lines: global CELLS if not CELLS: CELLS = objects.CellMappingList.get_all(context) LOG.debug('Found %(count)i cells: %(cells)s', dict(count=len(CELLS), cells=CELLS)) if not CELLS: LOG.error(_LE('No cells are configured, unable to list instances'))

'}]
commit_message:
Increase timeout for swift proxy operations

In RDO-CI we are hitting timeouts in swift operations
intermittently when running swift tempest tests in
scenario002.

This patch increases timeout swift::proxy as default
value seems to be too low for slow hardware as the one
used in RDO CI.

Change-Id: I05da916f9cef54873aa70460a293f16c79c0d8b4

and sometimes we miss messages with (err).

commit_message:
Revise OSSN-033 to note fix for HTTPSConnection

Later versions of Python have HTTPSConnection fixed. So OSSN-0033
should be clarified to only apply to Python earlier than 2.7.9 and
3.4.3.

Change-Id: Ib50d85dec5789749bb32ecd6d58b98dcd2670b6c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/security-doc refs/changes/10/442810/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: In many places, OpenStack components use HTTPSConnection to establish an SSL connection between endpoints. Early Python versions of this class does not provide many of the assurances one would expect when using SSL and leaves connections open to potential man-in-the-middle attacks.early Python versions failed to check that certificates are signed by a valid authority. Without that check in place, the subsequent checks (some highlighted above) are largely invalid.Later versions of Python, namedly 2.7.9 and 3.4.3, do do proper validation in establishing connections. So this OSSN only applies to environments running older Python. not. The OSSP suggest cloud deployers check the status of the bugPython 2.x doc : https://docs.python.org/2/library/httplib.html#httplib.HTTPSConnection Python 3.x doc : https://docs.python.org/3.4/library/http.client.html#http.client.HTTPSConnection
deleted_lines: In many places, OpenStack components use Python 2.x HTTPSConnection to establish an SSL connection between endpoints. This does not provide many of the assurances one would expect when using SSL and leaves connections open to potential man-in-the-middle attacks.fails to check that certificates are signed by a valid authority. Without that check in place, the subsequent checks (some highlighted above) are largely invalid.not. The OSSG suggest cloud deployers check the status of the bug

commit_message:
Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids.We should
use that function when generating uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: Ie3b9c10d8cab332d51b49d8a9b41283d3ef36b7a
Closes-Bug: #1082248

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-08 15:50:30.000000000', 'files': ['templates/swift_keystone_test.erb', 'ext/swift_keystone_test.rb', 'manifests/storage/disk.pp', 'manifests/dispersion.pp', 'ext/swift.rb', 'manifests/storage/ext4.pp', 'manifests/storage/loopback.pp', 'files/swift_tester.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift/commit/fb9e6dcecccb2593df917e81ea4ec6ac8e6892f0', 'message': 'Replace references to swift.openstack.org

The policy of giving projects vanity domains stopped about 5 years ago.
swift.openstack.org is a redirect to the canonical location -
docs.openstack.org/developer/swift. While we are not aiming to remove
the redirect any time in the forseeable future due to existing published
links pointing to it, we should at the very least stop adding more of
those links to the world.

Change-Id: Ia56ce22c65c1fac29a2d8fb367797a4d7929a9b4
'}]
commit_message:
Replace references to swift.openstack.org

The policy of giving projects vanity domains stopped about 5 years ago.
swift.openstack.org is a redirect to the canonical location -
docs.openstack.org/developer/swift. While we are not aiming to remove
the redirect any time in the forseeable future due to existing published
links pointing to it, we should at the very least stop adding more of
those links to the world.

Change-Id: Ia56ce22c65c1fac29a2d8fb367797a4d7929a9b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/94/443194/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
sahara: include authtoken class

authtoken class configures the keystone_authtoken parameters, required
to move to Keystone V3 auth.

Change-Id: Ibfd761fef813faa7bf13881c52c34e20d3eac9e5

added_lines: # 2016-09-22: Architecture support for s390x # IBM Corp., Holger Smolinski, <smolinski@de.ibm.com>if [ "$ARCH" == "s390x" ]; then if [[ "$IMAGE_BLOCKDEVICE" =~ "loop" ]]; then if [ "${BOOT_DEV}" != "${IMAGE_BLOCK_DEVICE}" ]; then PART_NO=$(echo $IMAGE_BLOCK_DEVICE | sed -er"#${BOOT_DEV}p\([1-9]\+\)$#\1#") else PART_NO="" fi else die "Disk type for image block device $IMAGE_BLOCK_DEVICE not yet implemented" fi fifunction install_zipl { if [ "$ARCH" != "s390x" ]; then die "Unsupported Platform for zipl" fi; install-packages s390-tools parted if [ -f /etc/zipl.conf ]; then cat /etc/zipl.conf sed -i".dib.bkp" "s/\(parameters=\"[^\"]*\)\"/\1 console=ttyS0 console=ttyS1\"/g" /etc/zipl.conf else parted -m ${BOOT_DEV} unit s print imagename=`find /boot -name "vmlinuz-*" | head -n1` ramdiskname=`find /boot -name "initrd.img-*" | head -n1` if [[ "${PART_NO}" =~ "[0-9]+" ]]; then offset=`parted -m ${BOOT_DEV} unit s print | awk -F':' '{ if ( $1 == '${PART_NO}') { print $2 } }'| sed "s/s//g"` else offset=0 blocksize=`parted -m ${BOOT_DEV} unit s print | awk -F':' '{ if ( $1 == '${BOOT_DEV}') { print $5 } }'` cat > /etc/zipl.conf <<here [defaultboot] defaultauto prompt=1 timeout=5 default=linux target=/boot targettype=SCSI targetblocksize=${blocksize} targetoffset=${offset} targetbase=${BOOT_DEV} [linux] image=${imagename} ramdisk=${ramdiskname} parameters="root=LABEL=${DIB_ROOT_LABEL} LANG=en_US.UTF-8 console=ttyS0 console=ttyS1" here fi; zipl } if [ "$ARCH" == "s390x" ]; then install_zipl elif [ "$DIB_EXTLINUX" != "0" ]; then

commit_message:
barbican: Use versionless keystone endpoints

This also moves the explicit usages of the Keystone V3 endpoint fromt he
EndpointMap, as using the uri_no_suffix defeats that usage.

Change-Id: I5f07a0cee07fa28b88c419e25e014094004b1bce
Partial-Implement: blueprint keystone-v3

commit_message:
Propose Redfish support into Ironic

- Adding the spec
- Ref: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1526477

Related-Bug: #1526477
Change-Id: I87a0072227d656da94b2ab216d8d17b30249fe1f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/53/184653/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================== Redfish driver ==================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/redfish-driver This blueprint proposes adding new driver that supports deployment of Redfish based servers. Problem description =================== The DMTF is working on a new specification called Redfish (Cf: http://www.dmtf.org/standards/redfish) to provide a RESTful based API to manage servers in a standard way. This bleprint aims at adding Redfish support to Ironic. Proposed change =============== New power and management interfaces will be added as part of the redfish driver. This driver uses the python-redfish library for communicating with a Redfish system. (Cf: https://github.com/devananda/python-redfish) Goal is to provide Power management similarly to what is done in the iLO drivers to start with. Later on, we'll add more inventory info and actions allowed by the Redfish specification. Alternatives ------------ No real alternative exists currently Data model impact ----------------- None RPC API impact -------------- None State Machine Impact -------------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Driver API impact ----------------- None Nova driver impact ------------------ None Security impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Scalability impact ------------------ None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- The following driver_info fields are required while enrolling node into ironic: * address: Redfish Manager hostname/ip-address * username: User account with admin/server-profile access privilege * password: User account password Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: bcornec Other contributors: rribaud Work Items ---------- * Add new redfish driver, extending power and management interface APIs. * Writing and unit-test cases for redfish driver. * Writing configuration documents. Dependencies ============ This driver requires python-redfish installed on the conductor node. Testing ======= Unit-tests will be implemented for new redfish driver. tempest test suite will be updated to cover the redfish driver. Continuous integration (CI) support will be added for Redfish servers. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== This driver will not break any compatibility with either on REST API or RPC APIs. Documentation Impact ==================== * Writing configuration documents. * Updating Ironic documentation section _`Enabling Drivers`: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/deploy/drivers.html with redfish driver related instructions. References ========== _`Redfish DMTF`:http://www.dmtf.org/standards/redfish _`python-redfish`:https://github.com/devananda/python-redfish

subject: validate-simple: Use custom THT templates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-28 17:35:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/734c83e79138090ee09208a850ac93a6265d27a5', 'message': 'validate-simple: Use custom THT templates

The main purpose of this commit is to allow custom
tripleo-heat-templates to be used for validation, removing the risk of
getting out of sync with the upsteam templates and letting us validate
the results of the scenario jobs.

In addition to that:

* create a full documentation for the role in the README.md file
* remove and rename role variables to make the naming consistent, remove
  variables where overriding them is not possible in the templates
* fix and simplify the validation script, add non-deprecated openstack
  client commands where possible
* remove dummy tests and vars files from the role

Change-Id: Iea3c0a3c8f4e10786cb15b60ff28cfb15065165e
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-01 15:45:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/2078e0db147a880a14d5b79f341c1cba3cc43905', 'message': 'validate-simple: Use custom THT templates

The main purpose of this commit is to allow custom
tripleo-heat-templates to be used for validation, removing the risk of

commit_message:
validate-simple: Use custom THT templates

The main purpose of this commit is to allow custom
tripleo-heat-templates to be used for validation, removing the risk of
getting out of sync with the upsteam templates and letting us validate
the results of the scenario jobs.

In addition to that:

* create a full documentation for the role in the README.md file
* remove and rename role variables to make the naming consistent, remove
  variables where overriding them is not possible in the templates
* fix and simplify the validation script, add non-deprecated openstack
  client commands where possible
* remove dummy tests and vars files from the role

Change-Id: Iea3c0a3c8f4e10786cb15b60ff28cfb15065165e

commit_message:
Update logrotation tests

Current fuel nondaily rotation work with dalay.
So we should add additional steps to take this into account.

Change-Id: I27d009a1018116a014c4db4027252ddd3d3dafc7
Closes-Bug: 1669740

commit_message:
Remove nova.conf truncate/refresh workaround

truncate-nova-config was added as a workaround for the following
bug.

  Duplicate sections in generated config
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.config/+bug/1568820

This workaround is no longer needed, as the root causes are now
fixed in both nova and oslo-config.

This workaround is also unused, as it was recently changed and
accidentally installed in the wrong location (nested one level too
deep in configure.d, and maxdepth is 1 in dib-run-parts).

For example, compare configure.d/ in stable/newton vs master
(circa ocata), and note the path differences.

  newton: http://paste.openstack.org/show/601802/
  ocata: http://paste.openstack.org/show/601806/

  newton: configure.d/40-truncate-nova-config
  ocata: configure.d/40-truncate-nova-config/40-truncate-nova-config

But it was a happy accident because this workaround stripped the
comments from /etc/nova/nova.conf, but now they're back as of ocata.

Related-Bug: #1568820
Change-Id: Iddae03f2d66cf534908dad884af55e2ae7d18d4b

ceilometer tests.

commit_message:
Usability improvement in instance detail page

In instance detail, action log table, we are displaying
the user id. it is not very useful since it is not user
friendly.

This patch linkes the user_id to the user detail page.
so the user can see the user details.

Change-Id: I390db312976aa8f8e0eaa5723ea21a58378b9659
Closes-Bug: #1524734

commit_message:
Require `complete_qs` if a query_string is in the mocked uri

To avoid issues with matchers being picky (or... not picky), require
that the matcher supply complete_qs if the query string is provided.

In almost every-single case complete_qs=True is the desired behavior.

Change-Id: Ieada6382eabcfb07f7198ca483a9894f651ea8ca

Depends-On: Id5e5ed9bf4f8b0f9eb376bfc7c5801f0956da1d9
Change-Id: I801e6740258ddea2a1b628a209970e0307d39d12

commit_message:
Change auth_version to v3 on Tempest

Keystone v3 API is CURRENT and the v2 API is deprecated now.
So we need to change the default config of auth_version to fit
for current API status.

Depends-On: Id5e5ed9bf4f8b0f9eb376bfc7c5801f0956da1d9
Change-Id: I801e6740258ddea2a1b628a209970e0307d39d12
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/31/441531/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG identity auth_version ${TEMPEST_AUTH_VERSION:-v3}
deleted_lines: iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG identity auth_version ${TEMPEST_AUTH_VERSION:-v2} # Use v3 auth tokens for running all Tempest tests iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG identity auth_version v3

commit_message:
Switch Zaqar to use Swift for messages storage

So we can remove Mongo dependency and save some memory.
We already have Swift in Scenario002, so we'll save resources on this
job.
Also, TripleO is now deploying Zaqar with Swift by default.

Depends-On: I9ce1bbc18d02383a5cdd3edbcf8c65c90165fb53
Change-Id: I0e1934dcfbed15405e6c44e4a07890125586eb5a

subject: Use real mocking in unit tests test_cname_lookup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-08 17:40:02.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/middleware/test_cname_lookup.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/110d7856de6e692b58cd300ab27738c63603037e', 'message': 'Use real mocking in unit tests test_cname_lookup

Replacing function without mocking creates weird behaviors as the results
of the tests sometimes depends on the order of the execution. Use real
mocking to avoid such behaviors.

Example: using real mock showed that test test_host_is_storage_domain was
wrong because it was not "reseting" the lookup_cname function at the
beginning of the test.

Change-Id: Ibc60697c9c850e6e3a108f0d906e8906c3f53ced
'}]
commit_message:
Use real mocking in unit tests test_cname_lookup

Replacing function without mocking creates weird behaviors as the results
of the tests sometimes depends on the order of the execution. Use real
mocking to avoid such behaviors.

Example: using real mock showed that test test_host_is_storage_domain was
wrong because it was not "reseting" the lookup_cname function at the
beginning of the test.

Change-Id: Ibc60697c9c850e6e3a108f0d906e8906c3f53ced
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/48/443248/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('swift.common.middleware.cname_lookup.lookup_cname', new=lambda d: (0, d)) def test_passthrough(self): @mock.patch('swift.common.middleware.cname_lookup.lookup_cname', new=lambda d: (0, '%s.example.com' % d)) with mock.patch('swift.common.middleware.cname_lookup.lookup_cname', new=my_lookup): resp = self.app(req.environ, start_response) self.assertEqual(resp, ['CNAME lookup failed after 2 tries']) @mock.patch('swift.common.middleware.cname_lookup.lookup_cname', new=lambda d: (0, 'some.invalid.site.com')) @mock.patch('swift.common.middleware.cname_lookup.lookup_cname', new=lambda d: (0, None)) @mock.patch('swift.common.middleware.cname_lookup.lookup_cname', new=lambda d: (0, '%s.example.com' % d)) def test_with_memcache(self): @mock.patch('swift.common.middleware.cname_lookup.lookup_cname', new=lambda d: (0, 'c.aexample.com')) @mock.patch('swift.common.middleware.cname_lookup.lookup_cname', new=lambda d: (0, None)) bad_domain = ['CNAME lookup failed to resolve to a valid domain']
deleted_lines: original_lookup = cname_lookup.lookup_cname cname_lookup.lookup_cname = original_lookup def test_passthrough(self): def my_lookup(d): return 0, d cname_lookup.lookup_cname = my_lookup def my_lookup(d): return 0, '%s.example.com' % d cname_lookup.lookup_cname = my_lookup cname_lookup.lookup_cname = my_lookup resp = self.app(req.environ, start_response) self.assertEqual(resp, ['CNAME lookup failed after 2 tries']) def my_lookup(d): return 0, 'some.invalid.site.com' cname_lookup.lookup_cname = my_lookup def my_lookup(d): return 0, None cname_lookup.lookup_cname = my_lookup def test_with_memcache(self): def my_lookup(d): return 0, '%s.example.com' % d cname_lookup.lookup_cname = my_lookup def my_lookup(d): return 0, 'c.aexample.com' cname_lookup.lookup_cname = my_lookup def my_lookup(d): return 0, None cname_lookup.lookup_cname = my_lookup bad_domain = ['CNAME lookup failed after 2 tries']

commit_message:
Modify stack_name regular expression in Orchestration API

The stack_name in request must match some regular expression, but
the code implementation and document description is inconsistent.

Change-Id: I02c09d2624253d9ce19735dbe745ff4d3321332d
Closes-Bug: #1671126

commit_message:
Add info for shared lock_path config in description

This gives some hint to a user that the lock_path may
need to be configured to a shared directory for some
services that share resources and depend on named locks
used by different projects.

Change-Id: I4467e52df6714f1c0309f28c6349055de6777cf8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.concurrency refs/changes/69/355269/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'Multiple services running on the same host with shared ' 'resources should configure a shared directory for both ' 'of their lock_path configurations. '
